title: Thunderlords being OVERUSED
body: This is seriously becoming an issue now since all I see now is THE ENTIRE ENEMY TEAM USING THE THUNDERLORDS MASTERY. I even went into a game where it was just me and one other teammate who DIDN'T have thunderlords. I know this is sounding pointless but in a game where we want diversity having everyone constantly using the same mastery every match is a little absurd. Maybe thunderlords needs a little tweaking perhaps?

replies.body: maybe you should get on the bandwagon.
Riot has already addressed the issue, You just need to open your eyes and red.

pbe 1/2 the na posts, 1/3 the euw boards, its been addressed, it is seriously not hard to go and look

and if you really need it, i'll give you a preview on the mastery fixes to balance them with thunderlord

Warlords Bloodlust: Heal increased to 10-25% of critical damage to champions and grants 30% attackspeed

Fervor of Battle: Stacks ~~14~~ 12 damage per basic attack maxing at 8, stacks are doubled on melee champions, spells that hit an enemy champion grant 2 stacks (2 sec cd)

Deathfire Grasp: 60% bonus attack damage and 25% ability power

Storm Raider: 2.5 seconds to deal ~~25%~~ 30 max health for a 3 second 40% movespeed buff with a ~~100%~~ 75% slow resist for the duration. 

Bond of Stone: Damage reduction increased to 4%

Strength of the Ages: health granted from killing monsters is doubled, and the heal is increased to 6% max hp from 100 flat

~~strike through is to represent the parts nerfed after their buffs because they were too op~~
SO WHAT!? If it works it works. It fits and goes well with champion kits. Even the pro players are using it.
The problem is it shouldn't be the number 1 viable mastery on everyone and their dog.
This is exactly what I'm trying to say
